page.title: 11BUILDINGS PETT LEVEL
page.content: S.E. corner of Fairlight - 30 houses, mainly{bungalows,}with attractive gardens, on unmade roads, owners mostly retired. South side of Sea Road back gardens suffering erosion. Haddocks cottages, a row of originally four, housing{lookout coastguards, Napoleonic Wars. One collapsed, one removed, cause, cliff erosion.Above Cliff End, attractive larger houses, pseudo vernacular, some{thatched,}date 1930's.Gardens suffer erosion. Pett Level - six small cottages east of Smuggler Public House, 17th Century, formerly coastguard. By Toot Rock, row of Victorian {terraced houses,}formerly coastguard. Scattered up Chick Hill and in the parish of Pett, mixture of pleasant houses and{bungalows,}including Lunsford Cottage whose lands were mentioned in original{Domesday Book.
